meanings.definition: A belief or principle that is held by a group or individual.
meanings.sent1: The wasms of the community shape their traditions.
meanings.sent2: His wasms guide his decisions in life.
meanings.sent3: The wasms of the family are evident in their daily rituals.
meanings.sent4: Her wasms are like a compass, always pointing her in the right direction.
meanings.sent5: The wasms of justice and fairness are deeply ingrained in our society.

meanings.definition: The act of behaving in a particular way or style.
meanings.sent1: Her wasms at the party were elegant and graceful.
meanings.sent2: The dancer's wasms captivated the audience.
meanings.sent3: His wasms on the basketball court were a mix of skill and determination.
meanings.sent4: The artist's wasms on the canvas spoke volumes about her emotions.
meanings.sent5: The actor's wasms on stage were truly mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: A system of thought or ideology.
meanings.sent1: The political wasms of the party members clashed during the debate.
meanings.sent2: The educational wasms of the school focus on holistic learning.
meanings.sent3: The fashion designer's wasms were reflected in the latest collection.
meanings.sent4: The philosophical wasms of the ancient thinkers still influence us today.
meanings.sent5: The religious wasms of the community provide comfort and guidance.
